words.def: the text appearing in a book, newspaper, or other printed publication
a British imperial capacity measure (liquid or dry) equal to 4 gills or 568.26 cubic centimeters
A cone shaped spool or bobbin on which thread or yarn is wound used most often for weaving.
a journey for some purpose (usually including the return)
a piece of jewelry that is pinned onto the wearer's garment
a sizeable hole (usually in the ground)
a dissolute man in fashionable society
a luminance unit equal to 1 candle per square meter measured perpendicular to the rays from the source
a silvery malleable metallic element that resists corrosion
the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of a circle
a unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
